intro: Henckelia urticoides, commonly known as the stinging nettle tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, stinging hairs on its leaves and stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with serrated edges, and the plant can grow up to several meters in height. Henckelia urticoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
